ygData.subject: Re: Special foraged foods
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Why is a Wood Elf s natural ability a contradiction? I used Forage all the time and NEVER had to buy food and rarely had to buy water until my GF s mage
ygData.messageBody:
> I think it would be interesting to get a list poll up to see how many
> bards on the list actually use forage or hide, or even have them in
> their hotkeys. We'd have to have a seperate section for wood elf bards
> as the wood elf natural cap is actually 10 higher than the default
> bard's (hmm, another contradiction to the jack of foraging idea)

Why is a Wood Elf's natural ability a contradiction?

I used Forage all the time and NEVER had to buy food and rarely had to buy
water until my GF's mage got her level 24 Summon Food and Water spells. The
only reason I stopped using Forage is now with the ease of summoning food I
don't have to keep a whole backpack to store all the different kinds of
foraged food. Otherwise, yes... 1 vote here for using Foraged. In my
experience, it's good enough.

Hide is a different story... I have it hotkeyed but would never rely on it.
It's fun for parlor tricks. : ) I don't mind it failing most of the time,
it's just not knowing if it's failed or not that's a bad design.

Darkfox Reven'tsol of Xegony
